name: DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Phoenix

reviews.text: This was my hotel of choice for several years of business travel. I stayed at the Doubletree at least 1 - 2 times per month for three years and was never disappointed in the service. The rooms are spacious, and with a separate living space, are perfect for families. The delicious free breakfast makes the hotel a great value.
reviews.title: perfect for business

reviews.text: Very clean and great location to Sky Harbor Airport! highly recommend this hotel! Very friendly staff and wonderful pool and rooms! I will be using this hotel quite often from now on! A great place to stay
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from a business trip in Phoenix and my stay at the Doubletree was excellent. The shuttle picked me up 2 minutes after the call from the airport and I was greeted with a cold bottle of water. The driver was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, internet reliable, and the food very good.
reviews.title: Sunny Phoenix - Doubletree

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff, clean, large rooms. Fast shuttle pick up & return to airport. Warm cookies upon arrival. Easy to book online. Written directions to return our rental car saved the confusion of infrequent travelers in a strange city. Check out via TV was appreciated.
reviews.title: Phoenix DoubleTree

reviews.text: Very friendly staff, excellent location. Hotel a little old but clean, good gym for the gym goers. The rooms have 80's furniture but are clean and the room service is excellent. The tables and chairs in the atrium are very good spots to read and relax. Very pleased with hotel.
reviews.title: Friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love coming to the Doubletree when I'm in Phoenix. It's pleasant, rooms are spacious, the breakfast is great, front desk is helpful, close to airport (but not too close), close to public transport... What's not to like?
reviews.title: Great Stay
Great Hotel!
reviews.text: The hotel met all our expectations. We enjoyed having the separate sleeping area from the living room area of the room. It allowed for one of us to either stay up late or get up early without disturbing the other one. The light rail is located a block away. The surrounding area felt safe when we made the walk early in the morning and late at night. The $20 weekly rail pass was perfect. (Kids and seniors are 1/2 price) We were able to go to the Phoenix Zoo, Botanical Garden (1 mile walk from zoo), Phoenix Convention center and downtown area, Heard Museum and a Target Super Store. The grounds of the hotel were kept well groomed of leaves. Looking out our front window was the top of orange trees and a courtyard view of the pool. The pool has a 3' area perfect for little kids which gradually increased to 8'. The hot tub made all the walking we did during the day a great escape in the late evening until 11 pm. The gym with free weights an exercise bike, treadmill and elliptical met my needs. The entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Ray who provide our transportation to and from the airport, the front desk staff who allowed us to check in a little early and stay a little past check out, and the breakfast wait staff. The hot breakfast had a large selection that never disappointed us. There was always an assortment of fresh cut up fruit, fruit to go, yogurt, steel cut oatmeal, eggs, a type of potato, toast and either waffles or pancakes. Orange juice, cranberry juice, milk and hot beverages were also available. The business center was just outside the buffet, which was perfect to check email briefly or print out an itinerary for the day before heading out. In order to prevent virus' you just can't use the USB. So plan on bringing extra SD cards as you will want to take a ton of pictures. The hotel is about 20 minutes from the Phoenix Convention Center, Chase Field, and the downtown area. Being on the light rail and not driving in traffic or having to park, made the trip seem like 5 minutes. I highly recommend the hotel for its location and service, and for its lower prices than the downtown hotels. The added benefit of breakfast and close proximity to the rail/buses makes it perfect. Prepaying saved us 20% on their website.

Hotel is well maintained with a good staff. Room was clean and quiet. There was no difficulty in setting a pleasant temperature for the room. I'm allergic to feathers and the hotel had down pillows. The hotel staff quickly replaced these with foam pillows when we called Room Service. The breakfast did not taste good. In addition, the selection was limited due to lack of restocking items.
reviews.title: Doubletree Phoenix @ 44th St. & Van Buren

reviews.text: My husband and I took a weekend trip to Phoenix to celebrate our anniversary. The Doubletree hotel had pretty grounds and a decent breakfast. The room (we had a King suite) was ok. It had a separate little area from the bedroom with a fridge, couch, table, and sink. However, it smelled like smoke. We do not smoke, and I can't stand the smell of smoke. It was obvious our room was not a non-smoking room, even though we booked a non-smoking room. Overall, our trip to Phoenix was wonderful, but I would not stay at this hotel again unless the rooms were updated and it was a non-smoking hotel.
reviews.title: Average room; nice grounds and location.

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for two nights while visiting Phoenix to walk for my graduation. I am from NJ and did not know the area. I initially made a reservation closer to the airport which was a very undesirable area. This hotel was close enough to the airport (although they do have a shuttle I had a rental car) but definitely safe!
reviews.title: Last minute stay was worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a welcome respite from the searing Phoenix heat and the terrible Millenium McCormick Ranch.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!

likes.disliked: — The fridge door had a tendency to skin the tops of one's toes if not careful.

reviews.text: Friendly and easy check in, a large suite with a very comfy king bed, warm cookies, helpful staff, and close to the airport without the airport noise.
reviews.title: This is Paradise

reviews.text: We were bumped from our flight and ended up staying an unplanned extra night, and we were given the same $99/night rate which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great for overnight stay

likes.disliked: — A bit of noise from the AC unit

reviews.text: We'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Hotel caters to business travelers or couples

likes.liked: — Good value for two room suite w/complimentary breakfast
likes.disliked: — No two bed guarantee; no bathroom privcy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is top-notch. The staff is very responsive to your needs. The restaurant is reasonably priced and a full buffet breakfast is included with the room. Transportation to the airport is handled in a very efficient manner. Great way to rest before a trip. The room rate and breakfast was only a few dollars more than parking at the airport...plus you get a good nights sleep before a full day of travel.
reviews.title: Park and Stay

reviews.text: Don't like paying for wifi especially when im staying on business but overall the hotel was great. Close to the airport. Great pool. Restaurant food and service was outstanding and the staff was very helpful. Check in was speedy. The cookie was of course excellent. Love the suite and the TV and channel selection was better than most
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: Great place to stay when staying in Phoenix for business. Quick shuttle ride away just call them with you land and they will pick you up. Room was nice and clean, perfectly suited. Free buffet breakfast which was actually a buffet not just juice and nasty pastries. Will stay again!
reviews.title: Great for business

reviews.text: We always use the Doubletree when we fly out of Phoenix. It is only minutes away with the shuttle. The rooms are mini suites with flat screen tvs in both the living area and bedroom. There is a free breakfast buffet in the morning. The staff have always been very attentive and kind.
reviews.title: Best stay and fly in Phoenix.
Geary at the Belvedere Bar
reviews.text: Geary well makes your stay wothwhile. He is well attuned to the business traveler and tourist alike and, makes everyone feel at home. I just wish the property kept the bar open past 11:00. Travelling for work often lands one late in the evening and, it would be great if this proprty kept the bar open until 1:00a during the week.

Hotel was very noisy. Could hear the cleaning crew throughout the hotel. Patrons walking around on walkways and stairs were very noisy. Expect 30 minute wait for the free breakfast buffet (eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, cereal, fruit, & muffins). Front desk was not helpful in advice for dinner. Tried to recommend a restaurant they had never been to.
reviews.title: Noisy and disappointed

reviews.text: Bathroom had a leak in the ceiling.
reviews.title: Really, really crap!!

reviews.text: Good location, nice courtyard area, free business center, & heated pool.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Clean home base for a Phoenix visit
Excellent facilites, Friendly staff = pleasurable stay
reviews.text: I booked a room at the Doubletree for an overnight stay in order to avoid the red-eye flight back East following my meeting in Phoenix.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the day of my arrival Phoenix was experiencing its heaviest rain for about 3 years. When I checked in, the clerk at the front desk told me I'd have to walk around the building and use the other entrance to find the elevators to my room. She then presented me witha cookie!
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property resembled and Embassy suites property with bedroom and sitting room as part of a suite.
reviews.title: Excellent overnight stay

reviews.text: The beds were excellent with good linens.
reviews.title: its ok

reviews.text: The breakfast was above average for a complimentary or included meal.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.text: There was no obvious aircraft noise.
reviews.title: Good Deal in Phoenix

reviews.text: Satisfactory shuttle service.
reviews.title: A Keeper

aka: Doubletree Suites By Hilton Phoenix Hotel
description: Start every day in style when you choose from our complimentary breakfast buffet at Belvedere's American Grill. A complimentary shuttle service connects you to the Phoenix airport, while the Metro Light Rail System is only one block away, making getting around while you are here stress-free.Make yourself at home in your spacious two-room suite at this Phoenix Airport hotel. A private bedroom and a separate seating area with sofa bed give you more flexibility for work or for the whole familyOur Business Class Technology Suites feature connectivity to most electronic devices for movies, music and computer monitor.DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Phoenix•Best Overall Customer Service Scores – Arizona DoubleTree By Hilton Hotels 2012•Tripadvisor Certificate of Excellence – 2013 & 2012•Tripadvisor Greenleader Bronze Level•DoubleTree by Hilton Excellence in Quality Award – 20th Consecutive Outstanding Quality Assurance Evaluation
